meanings.definition: The merging of two adjacent syllables into one in poetry.
meanings.sent1: In the poem, the synalepha made the words flow together smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The poet used synalepha to combine syllables and create a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent3: The synalepha in the verse made it sound like a song.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was a synalepha of beauty and grace.
meanings.sent5: The synalepha added a musical quality to the poem.

meanings.definition: The contraction of two adjacent vowels into one sound in pronunciation.
meanings.sent1: When speaking quickly, synalepha can occur and change the way words sound.
meanings.sent2: The pronunciation guide explained how synalepha affects the spoken language.
meanings.sent3: The synalepha in the word made it hard to understand for the foreign student.
meanings.sent4: His accent created a synalepha that made his speech unique.
meanings.sent5: The synalepha in her speech added a melodic tone to her words.
